required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Detecting Atrial Fibrillation in Patients With an Embolic Stroke of Undetermined Source (From the DAF-ESUS Registry)
clinical_study.official_title: Detecting Atrial Fibrillation in Patients With an Embolic Stroke of Undetermined Source (From the DAF-ESUS Registry)

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

brief_summary.textblock: The presence of interatrial block (IAB) is associated with the development of atrial fibrillation (AF). The aim of this study was to determine whether P-wave duration and presence of IAB before the implantation of a cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED) are associated with the presence of atrial high rate episodes (AHRE), during long-term follow-up.

detailed_description.textblock: The presence of interatrial block (IAB) is associated with the development of atrial fibrillation (AF). The aim of this study was to determine whether P-wave duration and presence of IAB before the implantation of a cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED) are associated with the presence of atrial high rate episodes (AHRE), during long-term follow-up.

primary_outcome.description: New episodes of atrial high rate episodes

study_pop.textblock: Patients in sinus rhythm, with or without previous paroxysmal AF and with dual-chamber pacemakers (PMs), implantable cardioverterdefibrillators (ICDs), and devices for cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) capable of atrial activity monitoring were included in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients in sinus rhythm
- with or without previous paroxysmal AF
- with dual-chamber pacemakers (PMs), implantable cardioverterdefibrillators (ICDs), and devices for cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT)
- capable of atrial activity monitoring were included in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
-Previous documented atrial fibrillation
